reviews.title: Good Choice for first stay in Tokyo
reviews.text: Close to Tsukiji subway. Convienence store and Maccas next door. Good room. Pleasant Staff. all rooms are high in the building so have views over Tokyo. Massage chair, quiet air con , reasonably large for Japan. Room was a bit tobacco smelling at first but the aircon cleaned that up. Warning sign on bedside table advising customers not to smoke in bed. I found the bed and pillows ok. Overall a nice four day stay.

We stayed here as part of our world trip, taking in a number of countries and hotels. The New Hankyu was excellent most areas. We arrived early, and they would not let us check in early, but we managed to store our bags. Once we checked in, we found the place excellent. Location was superb. We could walk to Ginza in about 15 minutes. We walked to the imperial palace in about 20-25 minutes. It was close to the train stations, and location overall was excellent. The room was very very large for Japanses hotels. The service was always excellent. The bed was hard as a rock, but ok for us. The massaging chair was nice, but would have been of more use if I found the instructions on the first day of our stay, not the last. To get there from the airport catch the limo bus to TCAT terminal (2900 yen each). Then catch a taxi to the building. This will cost abouut 1200 yen. Things to do. Check out the fish markets, or Ginza. Catch a subway to akihabara. Catch a short train trip to Tokyo Disneyland. Walk around Tokyo. Alll up a very enjoyable stay
reviews.title: Great hotel, great staff

reviews.text: This turned out to be a complete result. The view that greeted me when I got in the room was unbelievable and made the whole thing seem like excellent value for money. The hotel was well placed in walking distance of Ginza and a couple of minutes stroll from an underground station.
reviews.title: Amazing view - great choice
Comfortable, but bad mattress
reviews.text: Like the other reviewer said the bed was indeed quite hard - but I like a hard bed so was happy. Also I had two pillows, one very hard, one very soft so no complaints there.

Went to the bar one evening (you know - looking for Scarlett Johanson!) and couldnt get in as was full, but had a quick look out the window and discovered it had exactly the same view as my room - but a couple of floors down so it didnt matter at all.
reviews.title: Very comfortable, large room, great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 3 days and it was a great deal. Good access to the Hibiya-subway line (3 blocks from Tsukiji-station). We had a Superior Room with magnificent view from our window overlooking central Tokyo (Tokyo Tower, Ginza district, Tokyo Bay with Rainbow Bridge, Odaiba-island). Make sure you book a room with "city-view". The room was really big, compared to other hotels in Tokyo in that price range. Beds were very comfortable. The famous Tsukiji fish market is just 10min walk away and you will find many good Sushi-bars in the neighborhood with the freshest fish you can get.
reviews.title: good deal, great location, incredible view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cheapest way to get there from Narita Airport is the "Keisei Limited Express" train for 1.000 Yen to Ueno (the "Keisei Skyliner" is just 15minutes faster but costs almost double price). There you change into the Hibiya line (marked with a "H"-sign in grey circle and for about 160 Yen you can directly drive to Tsukiji-station ("H10")
reviews.title: Nice room, nice view, not bad location (great for Tsukiji fish market)
Great Hotel with a Great View
reviews.text: We would very much recommend to get a SUICA or PASMO-card for public transport. This is the most comfortable way to get arround in Tokyo as the fare is automatically charged from your card and it works for ALL metro lines.

I was Tokyo twice on a recent trip, and because I was unable to secure a reservation at my usual hotel I decided to try the Hotel New Hankyu Tokyo, mainly because the price was reasonable and it appeared to be in a good location. I found my stay to be satisfying, and I would consider staying their again in the future.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only tricky part is the location: the hotel is an easy 10 minute walk from Tsukiji station. The north exits from the station will drop you off by the correct intersection, and you only need to walk about five short blocks (until the street dead ends at the Sumida River). Once you get into a clearing, its very hard to miss the two towers (seen in the photo). Most of the two towers are associated with St. Luke's Hospital (they're adjacent), so you can simply ask for direction to St. Luke's if you need help on the ground (incidentally, this section of Tokyo was where foreign legations were located before the country fully opened up; the hospital has a few relics from that period).
reviews.title: thank you hankyu
Great Views at Hankyu
reviews.text: On a flying business trip to Tokyo I was booked in to this hotel by my Japanese business partner. It was the first time I had stayed there and I was pleasantly surprised. While the hotel is a short taxi ride from some of the restaurants etc it is well within walking distance of the Ginza and only 5 min walk from the subway. Roomas are spacious and very well appointed. I had a fabulous view across to Tokyo Bay from the 34th floor and the staff were friendly and spoke good english.

reviews.title: A wonderful place
reviews.text: I am returning in October and plan to stay there again.
